How can I list a specific range of transactions in the Verus system using the command line?

To list a specific range of transactions in the Verus system, you can use the `listtransactions` command with additional parameters. The syntax for this command is:
```
verus listtransactions "*" <count> <skip>
```
Where `<count>` is the number of transactions to display, and `<skip>` is the number of transactions to skip before displaying. For example, to list transactions 100 to 120, you would use:
```
verus listtransactions "*" 20 100
```
This will display 20 transactions, starting from the 100th transaction.

Examples:

List the most recent 10 transactions in the systems
> verus listtransactions

List transactions 100 to 120
> verus listtransactions "*" 20 100

As a json rpc call
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "listtransactions", "params": ["*", 20, 100] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
